content.description:
clip the first bolt and dive into the crux.  Use the small side pull and reach high to a small crimp just to the left of the second bolt.  Step up and grab the half drill hole and figure out how to mantle on top of the slopey corner.  follow the arete to the top 

  There are some indication this route was drytooled at some point.  It is a very fun rock climbing route and it would be a shame if it was damaged from drytooling.  This is the only route I would like to see not drytooled anymore.
content.location: The arete immediately left of the main ice climbing flow.  It is just above a newly installed bench.

content.description:
A bit of a trusty move on a side pull and a sloper foot to get to the first bolt.  The middle is fun with side pulls and gastons.  Crux is just before the last ledge.  There is a bit of fun between the last bolt and the anchors though. 

  This route can be rock climbed or drytooled. The top is currently kindof dirty and harder than it should be because of that.  I will clean it the next time I am there. 

  I named it Mad Dogs because the day I redpointed it my dog Pele was attacked by another dog.  Usually Pele is very submissive and just wants to have lots of friends.  I was pretty pissed at the owner of this dog and the dog at first.  Eventually the owner came over to apologize.  Apparently this puppy use to be a very social dog - until it got hit by a train and almost died.  I guess shit happens to dogs that make them hard and cold too. 

  There is one set of top anchors on the left of this route.  It can be toproped and I equip it next summer.
content.location: Three routes to the left of Spray, which is the arete to the left of the main ice flow

content.description:
Using the drill hole and large dimples for your feet reach high and clip the first bolt.  Climb up to the seemingly blank face to find a nice crimp, step up and gaston the flake on the right to get a jug.  Continue up moderate climbing to the top. 

  This is a fun rock route, but can be drytooled also.  Please becareful drytooling to not destroy too many holds
content.location: about 8 feet to the left of Spray which is the arete just left of the main ice flow

climbs.name: Derailed
climbs.fa: FA- Gabe Olson FFA - Sawyer Depies

content.description: This climbs starts just around the corner from  Spray on the Main Flow Wall.  It’s the only bolted line currently on the wall.  Start up the easy arete for the first two bolts, then battle the crux by traversing right along on thin rail of crimps and bad feet that get increasingly better.  After the 3 bolt, follow the bolt line straight up the  face, leading to a small roof and the wild red-point crux!  Once you stick the jug, you have the option to clip the last bolt of Spray on the arete or climb up a few more feet and clipping the last bolt of Derailed. Complete the final few moves to the shared anchor and Bobs your uncle.
content.location: Main Flow Wall, around corner from Spray.

content.description:
A bit of a crux getting to the first bolt, but then fun after that.  Stem up the blank section till you can get the jug on the right.  Then reach back left and go straight up.  It's a bit run out to the chains, but on pretty easy climbing.  If you got to the first bolt, this should not be a problem 

  This route can be rock climbed or drytooled. 

  Equiped by Jeff Engel, not sure who got the FA, although it has been drytooled before I am sure
content.location: Two routes left of Spray which is just left of the main ice flow
